summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 2020 requesting assistance for a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The request originates from the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to evidence handling.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in the Epstein case coordination, with M. helping to disseminate SA's request for assistance.

events.title: Initial Taint Review Request
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force sends an initial request for assistance with a taint review for the Epstein case.

events.title: Taint Assistance Offer
events.description: An FBI agent (TD) responds to the forwarded request, offering to assist with whatever is needed for the taint review.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force was actively working on the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June 2020.
The investigation required a 'taint review', a legal process to separate privileged from non-privileged material in seized evidence.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination for a 'high profile investigation', indicating continued resource allocation to the case.
The correspondence is dated over a year after Epstein's arrest in July 2019 and months after his death in August 2019, suggesting ongoing investigative or prosecutorial work.
